1.name: Die Büchse der Pandora
1.description: The rise and inevitable fall of an amoral but naive young woman whose insouciant eroticism inspires lust and violence in those around her.

2.name: The Broadway Melody
2.description: A pair of sisters from the vaudeville circuit try to make it big time on Broadway, but matters of the heart complicate the attempt.

3.name: Blackmail
3.description: After killing a man in self-defense, a young woman is blackmailed by a witness to the killing.

4.name: Piccadilly
4.description: A young Chinese woman, working in the kitchen at a London dance club, is given the chance to become the club's main act which soon leads to a plot of betrayal, forbidden love and murder.

5.name: The Iron Mask
5.description: King Louis XIII of France is thrilled to have born to him a son - an heir to the throne. But when the queen delivers a twin, Cardinal Richelieu sees the second son as a potential for ...                See full summary »

6.name: Why Be Good?
6.description: A flapper with a dubious reputation enjoys a vivacious night of dancing and finds herself romantically linked to her boss.

7.name: The Cocoanuts
7.description: During the Florida land boom, The Marx Brothers run a hotel, auction off some land, thwart a jewel robbery, and generally act like themselves.

8.name: The Canary Murder Case
8.description: A beautiful showgirl, nicknamed 'the Canary', is a scheming nightclub singer. Blackmailing is her game and soon ends up dead. But who killed 'the Canary'. All the suspects who knew her had ...                See full summary »

9.name: Lucky Star

10.name: Disraeli
10.description: Prime Minister of Great Britain Benjamin Disraeli outwits the subterfuge of the Russians and chicanery at home in order to secure the purchase of the Suez Canal.

11.name: The Hollywood Revue of 1929
11.description: An all-star revue featuring MGM contract players.

12.name: Coquette
12.description: A flirtatious Southern belle is compromised with one of her suitors.

13.name: The Love Parade
13.description: The queen of mythical Sylvania marries a courtier, who finds his new life unsatisfying.

14.name: The Virginian
14.description: A good-natured cowboy who is romancing the new schoolmarm has a crisis of conscience when he discovers his best friend is engaged in cattle rustling.

15.name: Sunnyside Up
15.description: Molly and Bee, sweet young 'working girls,' live in a cheap room over a New York grocery store. Molly's idol, wealthy Jack Cromwell, lives in a Long Island mansion but is markedly less ...                See full summary »

16.name: The Manxman
16.description: A fisherman and a rising young lawyer, who grew up as brothers, fall in love with the same girl.

17.name: Frau im Mond
17.description: A tenacious scientist blasts off for the moon in hopes of riches that may be found there.

18.name: Tagebuch einer Verlorenen
18.description: After falling pregnant to a pharmacist and refusing to marry, a young woman is thrown from her home and sent to a strict girls' reform school.

19.name: Hallelujah
19.description: A sharecropper decides to become a preacher after falling for a vamp from the city.

21.name: The Locked Door
21.description: On her first anniversary Ann Reagan finds that her sister-in-law is involved with a shady character from her own past, and determines to intervene.

22.name: Gardiens de phare
22.description: Two lighthouse keepers (the father and the son) are to spend one entire month in the middle of the sea near the coasts of Brittany;the young man is ill.

23.name: The Kiss
23.description: An unhappily married woman is caught up in scandal and murder when her affection toward a young man is misinterpreted.

24.name: Bulldog Drummond
24.description: A bored WWI veteran helps out a young woman, whose uncle is being held hostage by embezzlers.

26.name: Die weiße Hölle vom Piz Palü
26.description: A man climbs a 12,000-foot mountain to search for his wife, who was lost on their honeymoon. Another couple makes the dangerous climb with him.

28.name: Glorifying the American Girl
28.description: The rise of a showgirl, Gloria Hughes, culminating in a Ziegfeld extravaganza "Glorifying the American Girl".

29.name: The Trespasser
29.description: The trial and tribulations of a strong-willed woman who elopes and gives birth out of wedlock without telling her ex-husband.

30.name: Words and Music
30.description: Phil and Pete compete for Mary's love and also in a contest for best song written by a college student.

32.name: Gold Diggers of Broadway
32.description: Three Broadway chorus girls seek rich husbands.

34.name: On with the Show!
34.description: A musical advertised as the first 100% natural color, all-singing production. The plot concerns a wide-eyed former hatcheck girl who takes the place of a rebellious star.

37.description: A ruthless stockbroker sells short in the copper business and ruins the life of his friends by ruining their finances.

41.name: Show Boat
41.description: A mostly silent version of Edna Ferber's original novel, with some songs from the musical as a last-minute addition

44.description: A prince in Java tries to seduce his visitor's wife, but he's discovered.

45.name: Applause
45.description: A burlesque star seeks to keep her convent-raised daughter away from her low-down life and abusive lover/stage manager.

46.name: Arsenal
46.description: A soldier returns to Kiev after surviving a train crash and encounters clashes between nationalists and collectivists.
